A4.text: Nikita Sergeyevich Khrushchev (15 April [O.S. 3 April] 1894 â€“ 11 September 1971) was the First Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union from 1953 to 1964.

A5.text: Khrushchev authorized East German leader Walter Ulbricht to begin construction of what became known as the Berlin Wall.
